headline: Chef John's Shepherd's Pie
description: Shepherd's Pie recipes are traditionally done with lamb, but are great with any ground meat--turkey and beef being the most popular modern versions. Give this great casserole a try, and watch everyone flock to the table.
name: Chef John's Shepherd's Pie
recipeIngredient: 1.25 pounds Yukon Gold potatoes, peeled and cubed

recipeInstructions.text: Place cubed potatoes and garlic in a large pot with enough water to cover. Bring to a boil over high heat; reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until tender, about 20 minutes.
Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Brown ground beef over medium heat in a skillet. Stir in flour, mixing with beef drippings.
Add beef broth, ketchup and vegetables. Stir to combine. Cook for 5 minutes, until thick.
Transfer beef mixture into an oven-proof casserole dish.
Drain potatoes and smash them a little bit before adding 1/4 cup of grated cheese and sour cream. Mash together until smooth.
Spoon potatoes onto the middle of the meat mixture. With a fork, spread potatoes from the center to the edges to form the top layer.
Sprinkle with remaining 1/4 cup of grated cheese.
Bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until cheese is melted and golden. Let cool 15 minutes before serving.

review.reviewBody: Very good base recipe. I sautéed diced onions with the meat and added caramelized onions that I had in the freezer. Instead of ketchup I used Sweet Baby Ray BBQ sauce. A couple of tablespoons of sour cream in the potatoes and it is great. My husband and I love this.
bland. boring. ketchup added a weird sweetness. Plain white bread is more exciting than this sloppy pile of gloop.

Absolutely did not like this!! I tried the beef mixture before I put it in a cooking dish and the taste was awful. I think the ketchup ruined it. I ended up adding a dash or two of gravy master to give it a boost of flavor and it made it slightly edible. Then comes the potatoes. Yuck! The recipe calls for salt and pepper but doesn’t say where to add it- to the potatoes or to the meat mixture. I did to both! I also added onions to the meat mixture. If I were to ever make this again, I’d be kicked out of my house!
The family loved it! I have made it twice so far! Thank you!
I made no changes to this recipe. It was absolutely delicious. I froze slices individually and popped them in the microwave as needed. Very good.

I used ground moose instead of beef, and I doubled the amount. Subbed in Russet vs Yukon Gold, because that's what I had. May add some Worchestershire Sauce next time, for zip. Loved the potato taste!
We really enjoyed it and I always use Bob Evans ready made mashed potatoes, saves time and they are so much better than home made. They taste fresh, really helps the recipe.
Great stuff family loved it
I did 1lb of veal and 1lb of beef. I also did peas and corn. I would do more potatoes next time as I struggled to spread it evenly on the top.
Family favourite! I've been making this for years now :)
Very good recipe and easy to follow. I added whole kernel corn because…we like it.

I always watch the videos before I prepare so I can get an idea how it's done and then I follow the recipe. However, I did not catch the salt and pepper. I was able to mix it in after before I topped it with the potatoes

I added a chopped onion to the meat as suggested by others and it gave it much needed flavor. Instead of ground beef I used 1 pound of Impossible meat to make it vegetarian. And because I had it on hand, I used tomato paste instead of ketchup, which I think also helped with adding flavor. Overall, I would definitely make this again.

This is the first chef John recipe I have HATED. This is the first shepherds pie recipe I’ve ever hated! This is so unbelievably bland. I added salt. I added ketchup. I added hot sauce. But it just couldn’t make up for a bad recipe. We threw most of it out and made a frozen pizza. But I was sooooo disappointed I love shepherds pie and I love chef John. This one just isn’t it.
He made this with Kraft red pepper Italian dressing instead of ketchup.

It was a bit bland. The instructions never indicate when to add the salt & pepper, so don’t forget to do that. Also, next time I think I will barbecue sauce instead of ketchup and increase the sour cream amount for extra zing.
It’s was amazing ????

Well, I used this as a guide. I use smoked chuck roast. I shred it and added a bag of frozen peas and carrots. I also cheat and top with Bob Evans mashed potatoes. Hey, I love food but I'm lazy. I used most of his ingredients. It is so tasty using Smoked meat. After I smoked the roasts for 4 hours I put them in a pan with cut up onions and green peppers with some broth and foil the pan and take off once they hit 203 IT. I made it 3 weeks ago and am making it again right now. It is that good.
Easy and really tasty. My family loved it!
As always Chef John has another hit for my table!
It was fun I didn’t use frozen vegetables even my son came in and was that smells amazing
So easy to make and little mess. I didn't have beef broth so I used 1 packet of beef gravy mix I also substituted 2 cans mixed vegetables Instead of frozen. It was great. My husband loves it.

I really liked it, but it was a tad sweet. I substituted tomato paste for the ketchup but it still had a bit too much sweetness. Could have come from the vegetables (frozen peas, carrots, and corn.) I also used ground lamb and an extra sharp English Cheddar. I will definitely make again, but I will add some additional spices.

I had never made nor eaten Shepherds pie before now. The only thing I changed was that I added extra cheese to the top. My family loved this. I served it with a fresh salad from the garden and it was a perfect Saturday night meal.

some minor adjustments: frozen veggies not a chance, thin sliced a carrot, half a head of broccoli and some string beans. Had half a red bell but forgot to add it, bummer. used a pound of ground chix and seasoned it with oregano, basil, mustard, cumin, s &p, and chix seasoning while cooking it. didn't have sour cream so i used herbed cream cheese and creme fraiche more s&p. came out awesome........
Turned out great. Followed directions exactly and it was pretty easy and quite delicious.

2.5 stars only. It's edible. Quite boring flavor and the potatoes were very dry. I was intent to follow the recipe, since it had a high rating. After tasting, I added more of just about everything trying to give more flavor, but still blah. I should've figured out the the potatoes would be DRY without adding any milk like normal mashed potatoes, but I trusted the recipe. Wrong. My advice: I'd look for a different recipe, because even a LOT of tweaking didn't help this one out much.
My family liked it very much. Would give it a 4.5 star rating. It was easy to make. Seconds for everyone.

While I am usually a fan of Chef Johns recipes this one fell short for us. I did not like the ketchup flavor in this at all. I ended up adding Worchester sauce and some gravy master to the meat mixture which helped tremendously.
Added a little worcestershire sauce for added flavor.

I made a few changes, but it has turned out amazing! Instead of ketchup, I used diced tomatoes plus other spices like thyme, rosemary, minced garlic and powdered garlic, minced onion and parsley. Instead of boxed beef broth, I mixed beef bullion and brown gravy mix into some water for added flavor. In the mashed potatoes, I added some 5 cheese Italian shredded cheese plus white cheddar and some cream cheese as well.
I love everything that Chef John does, so I wasn't surprised that this was a winner. Yum!! Thanks Chef J!!
Great comfort food. Only change, add more seasonings. Added 1 tbsp hot sauce, but need to add more &pepper flakes, maggi .
I usually don't measure but just eyed the ingredients and added a little more ketchup. My family loved it!!

i feel that this is a very good generic shepherds pie. not much change as been added. i would recommend making some form of garlic/cheesy mashed potatoes for on top. as this was semi-boring favour-wise. Great base recipe for those willing to adjust!

We spiced up our lives on this recipe by using 3/4 ground beef and 1/4 hot sausage (rather than 1 lb ground beef) and adding our favorite hot sauce to the meat mixture! 

I also added some canned tomato sauce along with the ketchup. 

We used canned mixed veggies which worked well for us.

I love making these in ramekins for dinner parties to have the perfect serving size and crispiness.
This turned out perfectly, easy to make, great taste, I don’t eat much beef, so I used ground turkey and chicken stock, everything else was as the recipe calls for, try it, you’ll like it
I sautéed onions with grated carrots in with the ground beef. I added canned corn and frozen peas. I used a little tomato sauce instead of ketchup. This was excellent!

I'm giving the recipe 5 stars even though the way I made it was three stars. I read several reviews that said to add more broth for more gravy. I regretted that. It just made it watery and more like soup. Hopefully the leftovers will be better. Other than my mess-up, the recipe was great!
Good. Added more beef broth so it was dry. Needs more salt and pepper. Fantastic!
This came out good but I think caned vegetables would have been better.
I've made Shepherd's Pie before, but I do have to say this is "VERY GOOD" in my house. I have picky eaters and they had to have seconds. Definitely making this again.

Very easy to make and came out delicious. I did add adobe seasoning & lawry's salt to the mix. Also use 1.38 lbs of meat, and for frozen vegi's used 3 cups of Frozen Peas&Carrots. Will definitely put this in the rotation.
Great, easy week night dinner that could be modified to fit your taste. I made this according to the recipe but looking forward to trying again with different veggies.

Easy peasy lemon squeezy! I made this for the Christmas lunch today but with pork mince!! (coz that’s what I had handy) and a few changes:
1. Sauteed onions and mushrooms before browning the meat
2. Added dried basil, thyme, and red chilli flakes to the meat
3. Went easy on the ketchup

Now my shepherd’s pie is actually baking in the oven. Will leave my conclusion after we taste it! Fingers crossed.

Definitely a keeper! This even passed the test with our picky 8 year old — she wanted seconds! Very easy and perfect for a busy weeknight. I used ground turkey instead of beef but it still came out delicious! Thank you for sharing!

I had so much leftover mashed potatoes from Thanksgiving, I decided to give this a try. It came out fantastic. My kids said it was amazing! The only thing I did differently was I used only frozen peas and carrots, and not the mixed veggies because I'm not a fan of frozen green beans. I did add some S&P to the meat mixture! This was so easy and I will definitely do it again with my leftover mashed! Love Chef John's recipes!
I used fresh broccoli for over half the veg., 1fresh carrot and a can of corn. It was delicious!
I actually used ground lamb. Followed the recipe exactly other than that, and it was quite delicious! It's saved to my favorites, as are so many Chef John recipes.

Followed the recipe exactly. Wasn’t sure where to add the salt and pepper so I added it to the meat as another reviewer decided. Might have been better to add it to the potatoes instead. Haven’t had much success finding a Shepherd’s Pie recipe that I liked much before, but this was pretty tasty. Fit perfectly in a round two quart casserole dish that I have.
It is easy to prepare, still very tasty. Using beef instead of lamb was why i decided to try it.
My family loves this recipe! No changes necessary!
This was great. Like many others, I took out the ketchup and put in Worcestershire and added onions to the ground beef. So good
Really delicious. Couple of additions though; I added a little cumin, Oregano and onion. Tasty!

Really good! Added some Italian seasoning, seasoning salt and a little mustard to the beef. Instead of mashing the potatoes, I used the food processor which made them really smooth! Really like the cheese added into the potatoes.

Great recipe. I really like the garlic mashed potatoes on top. 

I used oregano and a savory salt mixture for the meat mixture seasonings, and instead of beef broth, I just used the potato water. 

Super happy with this recipe!
Excellent recipe! have made it several times and no need to change a thing. Although sometimes I cheat and use packaged mashed potatoes. Definitely not as good but a decent last minute substitite.
Pretty much can count on any Chef John recipe

Used cubes of steak instead of ground meat. Made it with several variations. Mixed parsley with vegetables instead of ketchup. Thickened beef stock with a roux. It was great to have this recipe to give me guidance .
Fantastic!!! I did add some thyme, paprika, and Worcestershire sauce, as another reviewer suggested. Now I’m repeatedly being asked to make this, again.
Very bland. Followed to a T. Like some suggestions on spicing it up a bit

I made this almost as stated but had to cut it to only two servings. After reading the reviews I tweaked it a bit with a little more spices and used Bob Evan's mashed potatoes. Put it in two ramekins and baked it for 20 minutes. We enjoyed it and will definitely keep this as our shepherd's pie go to recipe.

The mashed potatoes were great but the beef and veggie mixture was very bland. I’ll have to try adding garlic and/or onions to the beef mixture next time or maybe more ketchup. I was just disappointed by the lack of flavor.
liked it
I made it just as written. I used a rectangular 2qt Pyrex dish
Loved it, easysoloed! good!

I used ground lamb for this recipe. We were very pleased with the results! I made a few substitutions based on what I had in my pantry. First I made 4cups of instant mashed potatoes and added the sour cream and about 1/2 cup of shredded cheddar cheese. Second, I used water instead of the broth. Third, I used two regular cans of mixed vegetables drained instead of the frozen. I put the meat mixture in a 9 x 13 pan and spread the potatoes evenly over the top. I sprinkled the rest of the cheese on the top and baked at 375 degrees for about 20 minutes. Awesome!

A decent starting point for a quick Cottage Pie. But, ketchup is far too strong and sweet. Highly recommend tomato sauce instead. If you only have ketchup, cut the amount in half. We added approximately 1 tbsp of diced onion to the beef for more flavor. (A little garlic is an option.) To reduce the amount of fat, we poured off the beef drippings and stirred in a bit of vegetable bouillon with the flour and beef to make a "gravy".

Wish I could give this a 4.5. It was good. I did make a bit more broth and used a little less ketchup. Cooked the beef with onion and spices. I would make this again but probably with my regular mashed potato recipe instead. Also, it was a lot of mixed veggies next time I’m just using corn, peas and green beans to save all the picking around the carrots.
I'm always looking for things I can cook in my iron skillet. Everyone in the family loved this recipe. Easy to make and comforting to eat.

This was pretty good, but I did make a few changes: first, I sautéd an onion and a few cloves of garlic before adding the ground beef (I actually used vegetarian beef crumbles). The 3 Tbsp of ketchup was *way* too much & made it too sweet. I balanced out the sweetness by adding Worcestershire sauce & vinegar as well as salt & pepper to taste. Next time I’ll either skip the ketchup altogether or use only 1 Tbsp. I will definitely add the Worcestershire & vinegar again and maybe some fresh herbs like rosemary and/or thyme. I added a little bit extra broth & may add a splash of red wine next time. Great base recipe, but definitely taste as you go along & adjust the flavors according to your taste. The mashed potatoes, by the way, were fantastic!!!!
SO good! The entire family LOVED it!
Added extra beef broth and about 4 shakes of worchestire
I mixed half ground beef with half ground , sweet Italian sausage. WOW! This was an awesome "augmentation " to this great recipe.
Added a little more cheese to the mash. I love cheese.

I doubled the recipe and it fit perfectly in an 9 x 13 casserole dish. I added extra onion and garlic and some worcestershire, plus used a brown gravy packet in place of the flour. To save time, I used Bob Evans sour cream/chive ready made potatoes. (2 containers) Took me about 20 minutes from start to oven. 
It was very good, my son had seconds!

I made Chef John's Irish Shepherd's Pie last year for a family gathering and it was a big hit, but since I was cooking for just my husband and I this smaller pie seemed the way to go. It's terrific and so easy to throw together. I tweaked it a bit based on our taste preferences but made no major changes...since that's never necessary with any of Chef John's recipes! Thanks for another great one!!
Not a fan of ketchup, so I used a little less and substituted in a tablespoon or so of Worcestershire sauce. Just a personal preference, but the recipe was great. The whole family loved it.
Delicious!! I added some chopped onion to the beef and some bread crumbs on top

This was a fantastic guide, which was all I was looking for. I created my own flavor by adding a dash of cinnamon and some snipped rosemary to the meat while browning the meat (and a little more after it was browned.) I did not have broth so I added some of the potato water from the mashed potatoes and bullion cubes. 
I used butter and yogurt instead of sour cream. 
Mozzarella instead of cheddar. ... and a lot more peas and carrots. The family loved it.
Just a bit of added Italian seasoning.
this is legit gross. i have made many shepards pies and this is by far the worst.
Delicious and easy to make. I made this for a party with a St Patricks Day theme and it was a huge hit.

This was a hit! After reading over some reviews I decided to add the worchester sauce to taste. I also omitted out the flour and added a package of dry brown gravy which added that perfect consistency of gravy and taste! Served with cheddar biscuits. Definitely a keeper for comfort food on a cold winter night.
Will definitely make this again. Tasted awesome and rave reviews from all.
This recipe was bland and definitely needs some seasoning.
Wonder Shepherds Pie! It’s obviously a modified American version of an old fashioned favorite. I added some onion & garlic, seasoned all layers with salt & pepper and will definitely make it again.

My family and I LOVE this recipe! The beef mixture just needs more flavor. I have tweaked this recipe for more flavor. Added 1/4 minced onion to the ground beef when frying. Drain grease! Used bag of frozen peas/carrots steamed in microwave. Meat mixture: 1 cup peas/carrots; Increased to 1/2 C of ketchup; added 2 dash’s Worcestershire sauce and 1/2 tsp salt. Sprinkled cheddar cheese on top of meat mixture. Used 1 container Bob Evans mashed potatoes prepared. Baked 20 minutes and then topped with cheddar cheese for 5 minutes or less
Will double this recipe from now on to last longer. It’s a delicious winter dish.

Great recipe to use as a base. I added a few things. First, a small pinch of Rosemary, a few shakes of worchestershire, cup of carrots, 1 stalk of cellery, a whole red onion diced, half cup of frozen corn, a can of diced tomatos, and a couple shakes of hot sauce. Its not quite like John or mom meant it to be but its great :)
Good basic recipe but bland. I added some Worcestershire, onions and garlic to the meat which helped, but it needs more of something.

This is a good, easy, comfort food recipe. I was doing a trial run before I made it in larger quantities for a crowd, and I'm glad I did, because the ingredient list called for salt and pepper, but nowhere in the recipe were instructions when to add them. I added them to the vegetable mixture, and I also added a couple teaspoons salt to the water when cooking the potatoes, which is what I usually do when boiling potatoes. The seasoning seemed about right that way. The potatoes were good with the sour cream and cheese, but I thought there should have been more, maybe 2 pounds instead of 1.25 pounds of potatoes. I could not completely cover the veggies. I used a 32 oz. bag of frozen mixed vegetables, and that worked well, although my personal preference would have been just peas and carrots and no green beans. I cooked this in a 9.5x13.5 casserole dish, and that was the right size for this.
It was delicious-good old comfort food, a real rib sticker. I’m not sure that the sour cream and cheese enhances the potatoes as we might have thought but nonetheless, it was a hit!

Loved this recipe with the changes I made. I sauteed 1 onion, 5 medium mushrooms and a can of corn instead of the frozen mixed veggies. I left out the ketchup but didn't add any other tomato product as I'm sensitive to the the acid.
I can see this as a great base to start with and making other vegetable substitutes.
My 4 star rating was because of the veggies and ketchup.

Instead of using meat drippings, I cooked up the beef with 4 slices of chopped bacon. I also substituted sour cream with light sour cream and added 2 tablespoons of almond milk to the potatoes. Substituted ketchup with an organic sugar free ketchup and think next time I'll add more. Lastly I used 50% cheese substitute with regular cheese so that it wasn't so much dairy and more variety. Great recipe! I think I found my parent's favorite dish to cook for them.

I kick it up a notch by adding a teaspoon or so of gravy master to the beef and vegetables mixture. I also use more potatoes about double for a thicker topping. I keep the original cheese and sour cream measurements though. Delicious!

I made this tonight for dinner and it was excellent. The only changes I made was to add a chopped onion with the hamburger. Also I drained the fat from the hamburger and added an extra cup of beef broth. Thought it was best to lower the fat content . The pie was so delicious. Seasoning perfect . I will definitely be making this again.

This is a great recipe - simple and tasty! My dad lives alone and doesn’t cook much, so I try to make him some dishes that he can easily take out of the freezer and heat up. This is one I do regularly.. I triple the recipe and get mini loaf foil pans to make individual servings. I just make the mashed potatoes as I normally would with some butter, milk, sour cream, and salt and pepper. I throw foil over the tins and put them in the freezer. Perfect!
perfect!!!!
I used fresh carrots, should have cooked them first. Mixed chorizo and jalepenos with the beef for a little kick.
